title: Oswald Mosley
summary: Sir Oswald Ernald Mosley, 6th Baronet (16 November 1896 â€“ 3 December 1980) was a British politician who rose to fame in the 1920s as a Member of Parliament and later in the 1930s, having become disillusioned with mainstream politics, became the leader of the British Union of Fascists (BUF).[1][2]
